note.p: Education: BA (1795, Senior Wrangler) MA (1798) Caius College, Cambridge
Career: Fellow of Caius College (1798-1823); Published "The Principals of analytical calculation" (1803); Lucasian Professor of Mathematics, Cambridge (1820); Plumian Professor of Astronomy (1822)
References: W Johnson, 'Contributors to Improving the Teaching of Calculus in Early 19th-Century England' in NR 1995 vol 49 pp 93-103
P M Harman, 'Newton to Maxwell: the Principia and British Physics' in NR 1988 vol 42 pp 75-96
Notes: DNB gives date of death as 28 December 1827
